title: Sonic Painting and the Widest Possible Frame, Turning the Spoon in the Fabric of Reality, Orthodoxy
description:
Matt's Channel:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DgbRJxNV9YI

Matt was the first member of his family to attend University.
Navigating that environment without guidance presented a variety of challenges. Looked for meaning in church but eventually fell into agnosticism.
Became fascinated with Kierkegaard about 10 years ago.
Dived into philosophy.
The margin of the whole circle of Christendom.
The imagining of the context.
Things that matter.
Icons - they are not portraits, but portals into another way of seeing reality.
Music is a way of painting sound. Sonic painting.
When we consider an idea, is it still an idea, or is it an idea about an idea?
Beauty is a zip bomb.
Jesus answers then problem of the one and the many.
Is the one always primary to the many, or is it a summation? In Jesus, it is both.
“Wherever you find beauty, you find symmetry, a place of reconciliation, a kind of measuring together using the same measuring rod.” Quoting who?
Beauty entreats us, leads us forward.
Like the Esther Lightcap Meek idea of all knowledge beginning as a gift from the One and when the gift is received, we develop a loving relationship with the knowing.
Telling the truth, because language is a choice. Every word we use is a moral arena.
Fractals, the mandelbrot set, have parallels in the liturgical life.
Around age of 25, people have a tendency to settle for a habit, and if that habit is upset, it can become disorienting, a kind of cognitive dissonance and one can wake up to the challenges of reality again. Matt fell into agnosticism and nihilism.

Two years in the call center in Lincoln, NE brought a realization, and he began the trek to California.
Faith is a passion, not a logic.
The narrative order.
Cognition is embodied, needs a motor output. “I do believe” says Jordan Peterson.
Do is an action word. Belief must have an action component.
Led to Eastern Orthodox sacramentality.
Joined a Russian Orthodox Church after having a noetic experience of God’s presence.
The nous is he place in us in which the presence of God occurs.

Orwell’s essay on the proper use of language for clarity of communication:
https://faculty.washington.edu/rsoder/EDLPS579/HonorsOrwellPoliticsEnglishLanguage.pdf

Jordan Peterson Silicon Valley Meetup
https://www.meetup.com/Jordan-Peterson-and-Meaning/events/268107327/

www.TheMeaningCode.com
www.karenwongart.com

Iain McGilchrist essay on meaning on sale at Kindle for .99 now
https://www.amazon.com/Divided-Brain-Search-Meaning-ebook/dp/B008JE7I2M/ref=sr_1_2?crid=24IJCQ5KQU4WB&keywords=the+master+and+his+emissary+the+divided+brain...+by+iain+mcgilchrist&qid=1580257369&sprefix=The+Master+and+His+Emissary%2Caps%2C317&sr=8-2

Iain McGilchrist book, The Master and His Emissary
https://www.amazon.com/Master-His-Emissary-Divided-Western/dp/0300245920/ref=sr_1_1?crid=24IJCQ5KQU4WB&keywords=the+master+and+his+emissary+the+divided+brain...+by+iain+mcgilchrist&qid=1580257473&sprefix=The+Master+and+His+Emissary%2Caps%2C317&sr=8-1
